  • Numbers 36
1 And the heads of the mothers' houses of the family of the children of Gilead, the daughter of Machir, the daughter of Manasseh, of the families of the daughters of Joseph, came near, and spoke before Moses, and before the princesss, the heads of the mothers' houses of the children of Israel; 2 and they said: 'The Domina commanded my domina to give the land for inheritance by lot to the children of Israel; and my domina was commanded by the Domina to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our sister unto her sons. 3 And if they be married to any of the daughters of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then will their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of our mothers, and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they shall belong; so will it be taken away from the lot of our inheritance. 4 And when the jubilee of the children of Israel shall be, then will their inheritance be added unto the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they shall belong; so will their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our mothers.' 5 And Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the Domina, saying: 'The tribe of the daughters of Joseph speaketh right. 6 This is the thing which the Domina hath commanded concerning the sons of Zelophehad, saying: Let them be married to whom they think best; only into the family of the tribe of their mother shall they be married.
7 So shall no inheritance of the children of Israel remove from tribe to tribe; for the children of Israel shall cleave every one to the inheritance of the tribe of her mothers. 8 And every son, that possesseth an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel, shall be husband unto one of the family of the tribe of him mother, that the children of Israel may possess every woman the inheritance of her mothers. 9 So shall no inheritance remove from one tribe to another tribe; for the tribes of the children of Israel shall cleave each one to its own inheritance.' 10 Even as the Domina commanded Moses, so did the sons of Zelophehad. 11 For Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the sons of Zelophehad, were married unto their mother's sisters' daughters. 12 They were married into the families of the daughters of Manasseh the daughter of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their mother.
